Package gui.ProductControlScreens

Class ProductManagementScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.ScreenController
gui.ProductControlScreens.ProductManagementScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ProductManagementScreenController extends ScreenController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The screen allows the user to add, edit and delete products. It also allows the user to view products in the warehouse or in specific machines.
Author:
Lior

  • Constructor Details

    • ProductManagementScreenController

      public ProductManagementScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the product management screen.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - - the location of the FXML file
      resources - - the resources used to localize the root object

    • initNewProductElements

      private void initNewProductElements()
      Initializes the elements of the new product section. It sets the machine ID text and choicebox to be invisible by default. It also calls a request to the server to get all machine locations. These locations are added to the location choicebox. It also sets the comboboxes and locationbox.

    • addProductToDatabase

      void addProductToDatabase(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is used to add new product to the data base.
      Parameters:
      event - action event

    • refreshTable

      void refreshTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Refreshes the product table data. It calls a request to the server to get the updated product data. The data is then added to the table.
      Parameters:
      event - - the mouse event that triggers the method

    • initCols

      private void initCols()
      Initializes the columns of the product table. It sets the cell value factory for each column to the appropriate field in the product object.

    • checkAndReplace

      private void checkAndReplace(Product product)
      Check the array list of changes to be made, and replaces the old product in the array list with the new product if it already exist in the array list
      Parameters:
      product - the new product to be added or replace the old one

    • loadData

      private void loadData()
      This method is responsible for loading the data that is displayed in the table view of the products. It retrieves the data from the server and adds it to the observable list dataTable, which is then set as the items of the table views.

    • setComboBoxes

      private void setComboBoxes()
      Sets the items in the comboboxes. It calls a request to the server to get all the machine IDs and areas. These are then added to the appropriate comboboxes.

    • initLocationBox

      void initLocationBox()
      Initializes the location choice box. It sets the default value to "New Product" and adds a listener to the choice box. The listener updates the visibility of the machine ID text and choicebox based on the selected location.

    • uploadChangesToDataBase

      void uploadChangesToDataBase(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is used to upload changes made to the products to the database
      Parameters:
      event - this is the event that triggers the method

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Event handler for the exit button, prompts the user to confirm before exiting the application, if there are unsaved changes.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggers the method.

    • goBackToCEOMainScreen

      void goBackToCEOMainScreen(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is responsible for handling the event of the user clicking the "back" button. It navigates the user back to the main screen of the CEO if the user is the CEO or the main screen of the area manager if the user is an area manager.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "back" button
